text: @ScrambledAdams But the cold, severe glance with which he had been talking all the time, and which haunted him with all their charm.

passages.fragment: But the cold , severe glance with which he had
passages.full_quote: <used>But the cold, severe glance with which he had</used> looked at her when he came to tell her he was going had wounded her, and before he had started her peace of mind was destroyed

passages.fragment: with which he had been talking all the
passages.full_quote: Levin talked now not at all with that purely businesslike attitude to the subject <used>with which he had been talking all the</used> morning
"Yes, the Countess and I have <used>been talking all the time, I</used> of my son and she of hers," said Madame Karenina, and again a smile lighted up her face- a caressing smile intended for him
When I raised my eyes again, I found that he had been shrewdly looking at me <used>all the time, and</used> was doing so still

passages.fragment: the time , and which haunted him with all their charm
passages.full_quote: That, having expiated his sin against the husband, he was now bound to renounce her, and never in future to stand between her with her repentance and her husband, he had firmly decided in his heart; but he could not tear out of his heart his regret at the loss of her love; he could not erase from his memory those moments of happiness which he had known with her and had so little prized at <used>the time, and which haunted him with all their charm</used>
